problem_title: Zero-Latency Hazard Detection for L5 Autonomous Vehicles
domain: Autonomous Vehicle Engineering / AI Safety Systems

current_situation.description: Current L4/L5 vehicles rely on massive sensor fusion (LiDAR, Radar, Cameras) to build a 3D world model. They prioritize 'caution' over 'intuition,' often resulting in phantom braking or paralysis in complex scenarios (e.g., heavy snow, erratic human behavior).
current_situation.technical_limitations: Increasing safety currently requires adding more sensors and heavier compute units. This increases latency (processing time), power consumption, and vehicle cost, making mass adoption difficult.

ideal_final_result.description: The vehicle inherently detects and avoids all hazards instantly, in any weather condition, without requiring expensive sensor upgrades or supercomputers.
constraints: Must not increase the vehicle's production cost
Must function without reliance on 5G/Cloud connectivity (fully offline)
Must not drain the EV battery significantly
